title: Track Premiere: Thousand Mile Channel – Invented Mountains
content:
Housewarming Records have been on something of a roll in the last few months. Releases for Wealth and War Mothers have both been on the radars of the kids at Crack In The Road, and rightly so, both are great releases for a label that’s just starting to get its feet off the ground. Their next release is by Thousand Mile Channel, a bedroom producer currently pursuing a film education in Austin, Tx. Thousand Mile Channel acts as James Lambrecht’s housing platform for his various film scores and instrumental work he produces. He creates work with a duel motive, he has one eye on an eventual visual outcome, while also focusing on creating music that can be heard in its own right. His first release on Housewarming will be released on July 15. For now here’s a teaser from the EP, Evanston Collective, a delicate little instrumental, full of flashes of energy and blissful melodies. The beauty is to imagine the film in your head.

Stream and download the track below.

Thousand Mile Channel – Invented Mountains by crackintheroad
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d24
